intro: Elcismia haastii, commonly known as the Haast's elcismia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
